item.title: One person command into multiple people
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:2, topic:404899”] if (command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Brandon”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“NAME”)))

So on and so forth.[/quote]

This and this for your case.

if (command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Brandon”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Austin”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Ryan”))) {

Read full topic

item.source: One person command into multiple people

item.title: One person command into multiple people
item.dc:creator: @n00b4lif3 n00b4lif3
item.description:
@n00b4lif3 wrote:

alright so im trying to do some stuff on my rsps server and i dont want to screw everything up while doing this so i thought i’d come ask here, so there’s certain commands that only one person in this case i can do, which my name would fill in the blank but how do i add more names? this for example is what i have now[code=java] }

private void customCommand(String command) {
	if (command.startsWith("getpass") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Brandon"))) {
			try {
				String otherPName = command.substring(6);
				int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

				if (otherPIndex != -1) {
					client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

					sM("Succesful password recovery!");
					sM(p.playerName + "'s password is: " + p.playerPass);
				} else {
					sM("Unable to get password");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				sM("Try ::getpass (playername).");
			}
	}[/code] how would instead of just having brandon have austin and ryan. so please help get three names in! thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: One person command into multiple people
